[[div class="templateInfo"]]
[[# What]]
+* What Is This?
----
This is a theme created by [[*user Lt Flops]]. It is intended for widespread use in any article in which dark mode or night mode are preferred.

Only use this if you understand what you're doing.

This theme is **__incompatible__** with **Black Highlighter**, **BASALT**, and **Sigma+**.
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo"]]
[[collapsible show="CREDIT INFORMATION" hide="CREDIT INFORMATION"]]
Flopstyle: DARK is a fork of the following themes:

* [[[theme:flopstyle|]]] [[size 80%]]by [[user Lt Flops]][[/size]]
* [[[theme:penumbra|]]] [[size 80%]]by [[user EstrellaYoshte]][[/size]]

Major credit to [[user JackalRelated]], who created the [*https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/theme%3Aflopstyle-dark/alt_logo_bw.png theme] [*https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/theme%3Aflopstyle-dark/alt_logo_tyrian.png logo] ([*https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ CC BY-SA 3.0]).

Last but not least, thank you to [[user stormbreath]], who reviewed the entire theme, and [[user Croquembouche]], who gave his input in a couple of areas.
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo"]]
+++++* >> [[[/forum/t-14594014/theme:flopstyle-dark#post-5253227|PATCH NOTES]]] <<
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="templateInfo"]]
[[# How]]
+* How to Use
+++* The Essential Information
----
= Please read this introductory section before setting up Flopstyle: DARK on your page.
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo"]]
@@      @@[[span class="bt bb"]]STEP 1. INCLUDE THEME[[/span]] Copy this syntax and paste it onto the top of your page:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
= **##var(--c-keyword)|[[include##** ##var(--c-symbol)|:scp-wiki:theme:flopstyle-dark##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo templatePadding"]]
@@      @@[[span class="terminal-span"]][OPTIONAL][[/span]] [[span class="bt bb"]]STEP 2. ADD BYLINE[[/span]] Copy this syntax and paste it directly beneath the rating module -- like so:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark" style="padding-bottom: 1rem"]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[module##** ##var(--c-builtin)|Rate##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**

**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"byline"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
**##var(--c-builtin)|@@[[span]]@@##** by authorLink **##var(--c-builtin)|@@[[/span]]@@##**[[span class="pointer"]](A)[[/span]]
**##var(--c-builtin)|@@[[span]]@@##** # **##var(--c-builtin)|@@[[/span]]@@##**[[span class="pointer"]](B)[[/span]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**
[[/div]]

@@      @@**2. (A)** Replace {{authorLink}} with the name of the author/any co-authors, and a link/links to the relevant author pages.

@@      @@**2. (B)** Replace {{#}} with the estimated time (in **minutes**) it would take a reader to finish your article. To estimate your article's reading time, you can copy the article text and paste it into the [*https://niram.org/read/ Read-o-Meter] tool, then round **up** or **down** to the nearest minute.[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]][[span class="bt bb"]]DISCLAIMER[[/span]] Read-o-Meter does not record or store your data.[[/span]]

@@      @@[[size 120%]]‼️[[/size]] Make sure there are no spaces between the lines containing the spans, otherwise this won't work as intended!

[[div class="tableb"]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-block
|name=https://i.imgur.com/hCGnFsp.png
|caption=,,An example of Step 2 in action.,,
|width=200px
|align=center
]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo"]]
@@      @@[[span class="bt bb"]]STEP 3. SET PAGE-TITLE[[/span]] Copy this syntax and paste it where you want to signal the beginning of your article:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"meta-title"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
Your Title Here
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**
[[/div]]

For accessibility reasons, you **must** do this on every page that uses Flopstyle: DARK.
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo templatePadding"]]
@@      @@[[span class="bt bb"]]STEP 4. SET [wikipedia:Breadcrumb_navigation BREADCRUMB NAVIGATION][[/span]] Copy this syntax and paste it directly beneath the page-title:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"pseudocrumbs"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
@@[[[parent-page-url1|1st Parent Page Title]]] » Child Page Title@@
@@[[[parent-page-url2|2nd Parent Page Title]]] » Child Page Title@@
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**
[[/div]]

@@      @@[[size 120%]]‼️[[/size]] If you are creating an article that requires the use of [[[listpages-magic-and-you|ListPages]]], not to worry -- you can still [[[listpages-magic-and-you#toc20|parent your fragments]]] as usual, but you must do so the traditional way. Functionality takes precedence over form in this instance.

[[div class="tableb"]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-block
|name=https://i.imgur.com/uKmDCe1.png
|caption=,,An example of Steps 3 and 4 in action.,,
|width=100%
|align=center
]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo"]]
Now... If the basic aesthetics are all you want from Flopstyle: DARK, you are free to grab that code and skedaddle! But if you keep scrolling, I can show you how deep this rabbit hole goes.
[[/div]]

@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@

[[div class="templateInfo"]]
= [[span class="tb"]]Flopstyle: DARK was designed with the following components in mind...[[/span]]
[[/div]]

@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@

[[div class="templateInfo templateMargin"]]
[[# Cmpts]]
+++* 1. Preloaded Components
----
This theme comes prepackaged with the following six components:

@@      @@**1.1.** [[[component:acs-animation|ACS Animation]]] [[size 80%]]by [[user EstrellaYoshte]][[/size]]
@@      @@**1.2.** [[[component:betterfootnotes|BetterFootnotes]]] [[size 80%]]by [[user EstrellaYoshte]][[/size]]
@@      @@**1.3.** [[[component:croqstyle|Croqstyle CSS]]] [[size 80%]]by [[user Croquembouche]][[/size]]
@@      @@**1.4.** [[[component:fade-in|Fade In]]] (set at {{speed=1}}) [[size 80%]]by [[user Croquembouche]][[/size]]
@@      @@**1.5.** [[[component:text-style|Text Style]]] [[size 80%]]by [[user JaonHax]][[/size]]
@@      @@**1.6.** [[[component:toggle-sidebar|Toggle Sidebar]]] [[size 80%]]by [[user EstrellaYoshte]][[/size]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo"]]
[[# CVars]]
+++* 2. Custom Variables
++++++* (Only change these if you understand what you're doing)
----
All variable changes must be wrapped/encased in a CSS module, {{[[module CSS]]}}. All the ones listed must also be wrapped/encased in a {{:root}} selector.

@@      @@[[span class="bt bb"]]2.1. COLORS[[/span]] You can change a variety of theme colors as you see fit. Simply copy any of the following variables (but only the ones you need) and edit them as necessary:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[module##** ##var(--c-builtin)|CSS##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
@@ @@##var(--c-symbol)|:root##{
[[/div]]
[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
@@   @@##var(--c-comment)|@@/* -- COLORS -- */@@##
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@accentColor##: ##var(--c-value)|accent_color##;
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@accentColorLite##: ##var(--c-value)|lighter_accent_color##;
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@hue##: ##var(--c-value)|hue##;
[!--@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@textColor##: ##var(--c-value)|text_color##;
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@fgColor##: ##var(--c-value)|foreground_color##;
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@bgColor##: ##var(--c-value)|background_color##;--]

##var(--c-comment)|/* Defaults (Do not copy):##
##var(--c-comment)|@@ *   @@__accentColor:__## [[span class="col_box" style="background: var(--accentColor); border-color: hsl(325, 88%, 81%)"]]
[[/span]] **Bright Tyrian pink** hsl(325, 80%, 60%)##var(--c-comment)|.##
##var(--c-comment)|@@ *   @@__accentColorLite:__## [[span class="col_box" style="background: var(--accentColorLite); border-color: hsla(325, 88%, 91%, .5)"]]
[[/span]] **Soft Tyrian pink** hsla(325, 80%, 70%, .5)##var(--c-comment)|.##
##var(--c-comment)|@@ *   @@__hue:__## 325deg##var(--c-comment)|.##
##var(--c-comment)|@@**/@@##
[[/div]]

{{accentColor}} is the most extensively used page variable. Among all other variables, changing the accentColor is typically the only alteration that users of this theme will tend to make.

When you change {{accentColor}}, you must also change two other variables:

@@      @@**2.1. (A)** {{accentColorLite}}[[span class="bt bb"]][[size 0%]]:[[/size]][[/span]] This must have **higher** lightness and **lower** alpha value than your accentColor. I recommend a lightness of **at least 10% more** than your chosen accentColor's, and an alpha value of **0.5**
@@      @@**2.1. (B)** {{hue}}[[span class="bt bb"]][[size 0%]]:[[/size]][[/span]] This must match your chosen accentColor's hue.

To select the color of your choice, I recommend the [*https://hslpicker.com/ HSL Color Picker]. **HSL** is a human-friendly color system which stands for **H**ue, **S**aturation, **L**ightness. It can be expanded to HSL**A**, which includes the **A**lpha value (opacity).

To confirm that your chosen {{accentColor}} meets [*https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG/#contrast-minimum Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)], check its [*https://contrast-finder.tanaguru.com/ Contrast Ratio]. Insert [[span class="col_box" style="background: var(--bgColor); border-color: hsl(222, 62%, 63%)"]]
[[/span]] [[span class="wt"]]**hsl(222, 12%, 21%)**[[/span]] into the "Background" field, and your chosen {{accentColor}} into the "Text color" field. WCAG requires a contrast ratio of **3 or higher** for heading text.
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo"]]
@@      @@[[span class="bt bb"]]2.2. LOGO AND FONTS[[/span]] You can change the logo, fonts, etc.:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
@@   @@##var(--c-comment)|@@/* -- LOGO -- */@@##
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@lgurl##: ##var(--c-builtin)|url##(##var(--c-string)|@@URL_HERE@@##);
[[/div]]
[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
@@   @@##var(--c-comment)|@@/* -- FONTS -- */@@##
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@header-font##: ##var(--c-string)|"yourFont", sans-serif##;
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@body-font##: ##var(--c-string)|"yourFont", sans-serif##;

##var(--c-comment)|/* Defaults (Do not copy):##
##var(--c-comment)|@@ *   @@[[span style="font-family: var(--header-font)"]]__header-font:__ Montserrat, sans-serif[[/span]]##
##var(--c-comment)|@@ *   @@[[span style="font-family: var(--body-font)"]]__body-font:__ Inter, sans-serif[[/span]]##
##var(--c-comment)|@@**/@@##
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo templateMargin"]]
@@      @@[[span class="bt bb"]]2.3. HEADER TITLES[[/span]] You can also change the title, subtitle, title color, and subtitle color:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
@@   @@##var(--c-comment)|@@/* -- TITLES -- */@@##
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@header-title##: ##var(--c-value)|"TITLE"##;
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@header-subtitle##: ##var(--c-value)|"SUBTITLE"##;
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@titleColor##: ##var(--c-value)|title_colour##;
@@     @@##var(--c-builtin)|@@--@@subtitleColor##: ##var(--c-value)|subtitle_colour##;

##var(--c-comment)|/* Defaults (Do not copy):##
##var(--c-comment)|@@ *   @@__titleColor:__## [[span class="col_box" style="background: var(--accentColor); border-color: hsl(325, 88%, 81%)"]]
[[/span]] **Bright Tyrian pink** hsl(325, 80%, 60%)##var(--c-comment)|.##
##var(--c-comment)|@@ *   @@__subtitleColor:__## [[span class="col_box" style="background: var(--accentColor); border-color: hsl(325, 88%, 81%)"]]
[[/span]] **Bright Tyrian pink** hsl(325, 80%, 60%)##var(--c-comment)|.##
##var(--c-comment)|@@**/@@##
[[/div]]
[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
}
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[/module]]##**
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo templateMargin templatePadding"]]
[[# FlopsHdr]]
+++* 3. [[[component:flops-header|Flops Header]]]
----
Flopstyle: DARK provides for a dark mode-friendly version of Flops Header:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[include##** ##var(--c-symbol)|:scp-wiki:component:flops-header##
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|item####var(--c-keyword)|=##**
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|containment####var(--c-keyword)|=##**
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|level####var(--c-keyword)|=##**
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|security####var(--c-keyword)|=##**
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|disruption####var(--c-keyword)|=##**
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|disruption-bg-color####var(--c-keyword)|=##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
[[/div]]
[[div class="tableb"]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:image-block
|name=https://i.imgur.com/cGbnRpP.png
|caption=,,An example of the Flops Header in action.,,
|width=100%
|align=center
]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo templateMargin"]]
[[# Sideboxes]]
+++* 4. Sideboxes
----
Sideboxes are built-in components that come in two types:

* [[span class="bt bb"]]Type-A[[/span]] {{authorbox}} and [[span class="table1"]]{{sidebox}}[[/span]]
* [[span class="bt bb"]]Type-B[[/span]] {{sidecontainer}}

Usage instructions vary depending on the type.

* The {{authorbox}} and [[span class="table1"]]{{sidebox}}[[/span]] do not display on screens of {{width=1280px}} and smaller, which includes mobile screens. They can be set up to display page and author information.
* The {{sidecontainer}} collapses into the page edge on screens of {{width=1280px}} and smaller. On those screens, you can access it by tapping your finger or hovering your cursor over it. It can be set up to display additional narrative information.

Consider these conditions before setting up these items -- a sizable percentage of SCP Wiki users browse via mobile devices.
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo"]]
++++* [[span class="bt bh"]]Type-A[[/span]] Authorbox and Sidebox
++++++* (See Top Left and Top Right)
----
= ,,//Adapted from [[[theme:penumbra|Penumbra Theme]]] by [[user EstrellaYoshte]]//,,

By default, the {{authorbox}} is **opt-out**.  It comes preloaded on all pages that include Flopstyle: DARK. If you wish to //remove// it, replace this:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
= **##var(--c-keyword)|[[include##** ##var(--c-symbol)|:scp-wiki:theme:flopstyle-dark##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
[[/div]]

With this:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark centered"]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|style####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"display: none;"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[include##** ##var(--c-symbol)|:scp-wiki:theme:flopstyle-dark##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo"]]
@@      @@[[span class="bt bb"]]ALTERNATIVE 1[[/span]] After removing the {{authorbox}}, you can //replace// it with a custom version that displays any information you desire. This functionality can be especially useful for co-authored, rewritten, or translated pages. For your reference, this is the code that creates the {{authorbox}}:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"anchor"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**[[span class="pointer"]]Sets authorbox's sticky position.[[/span]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"authorbox tableb"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[module##** ##var(--c-builtin)|ListPages## ##var(--c-builtin)|name####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"="##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|||~##** ##var(--c-symbol)|%%title%%## **##var(--c-keyword)|||##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|||=## ##var(--c-keyword)|[[span##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"bt bb"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##** By **##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/span]]@@##** ##var(--c-symbol)|%%created_by_linked%%## **##var(--c-keyword)|||##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|||~##** ##var(--c-symbol)|Published on %%created_at|%d %b %Y%%## **##var(--c-keyword)|||##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[/module]]##**

**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"flavorbox"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**[[span class="pointer"]]Creates authorbox's flavorbox.[[/span]]
Desired {{flavor}} text here.
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**

**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**[[span class="pointer"]]Sets the end limit of the anchor.[[/span]]
[[/div]]

By default, the {{authorbox}} makes use of ListPages to automate the metadata displayed. You could theoretically copy the ListPages module inside the {{authorbox}} and paste it onto //any// Wiki page, and these fields would populate in a way unique to that page. You may, of course, change any of these fields as desired.

You may also edit your custom {{authorbox}} to display flavor text tailored to your page, such as a note to readers.

**REMEMBER** -- Using the {{flavorbox}} is optional. But it is the only div block you should use inside an {{authorbox}}.
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo templateMargin"]]
@@      @@[[span class="bt bb"]]ALTERNATIVE 2[[/span]] If you want, you can move the {{authorbox}} to the right-hand side of the page by swapping it out for the [[span class="table1"]]{{sidebox}}[[/span]]. To create a [[span class="table1"]]{{sidebox}}[[/span]], copy this syntax and paste it inside a CSS module at the top of your page:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"anchor"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**[[span class="pointer"]]Sets sidebox's sticky position.[[/span]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"sidebox tableb"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[module##** ##var(--c-builtin)|ListPages## ##var(--c-builtin)|name####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"="##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|||~##** ##var(--c-symbol)|%%title%%## **##var(--c-keyword)|||##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|||=## ##var(--c-keyword)|[[span##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"bt bb"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##** By **##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/span]]@@##** ##var(--c-symbol)|%%created_by_linked%%## **##var(--c-keyword)|||##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|||~##** ##var(--c-symbol)|Published on %%created_at|%d %b %Y%%## **##var(--c-keyword)|||##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[/module]]##**

**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"flavorbox"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**[[span class="pointer"]]Creates sidebox's flavorbox.[[/span]]
Desired {{flavor}} text here.
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**

**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**[[span class="pointer"]]Sets the end limit of the anchor.[[/span]]
[[/div]]

If you are planning to insert any {{sidecontainers}} onto your page, I strongly recommend using the {{authorbox}} instead of the [[span class="table1"]]{{sidebox}}[[/span]]. The reason being, when the [[span class="table1"]]{{sidebox}}[[/span]] and {{sidecontainer}} appear in tandem, they will overlap and become visually messy. This has the potential to be very confusing for readers. So, it's better staying on the safe side.

You can configure a [[span class="table1"]]{{sidebox}}[[/span]] to convey the same info as an {{authorbox}}. Or -- like with the one I showcase here -- you can add a snappy article tagline and unique icon.

Like any other table, you can also apply a unique tint -- e.g., the current green, as achieved with [[span class="table1"]]{{table1}}[[/span]]. Consult the **Table Formatting** collapsible under the [#GenFrmt Example Formatting (GENERAL)] section for further info.
[[/div]]
[[div class="templateInfo"]]
++++* [[span class="bt bh"]]Type-B[[/span]] Sidecontainer
++++++* (See Below)
----
= ,,//Courtesy of [[user Woedenaz]]//,,

The {{sidecontainer}} is **opt-in**. It is set up like this:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"limit"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**[[span class="pointer"]]Sets the start limit of the anchor.[[/span]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"anchor"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**[[span class="pointer"]]Sets sidecontainer's sticky position.[[/span]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[div##** ##var(--c-builtin)|class####var(--c-operator)|=####var(--c-string)|"sidecontainer"##**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
Desired {{sidecontainer}} text here.
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**
Text that the {{sidecontainer}} associates with.
**##var(--c-keyword)|@@[[/div]]@@##**[[span class="pointer"]]Sets the end limit of the anchor.[[/span]]
[[/div]]

I recommend inserting a manual line break after {{sidecontainer}}-associated text. You can achieve this by encasing a space with two sets of {{@@}} (one on each side). The {{sidecontainer}} will appear alongside this text as you scroll past.
[[/div]]

	flex-basis: 0;
}

[[div class="templateInfo centered"]]
++* Bootstrap Image Box
----
As an alternative to the Standard Image Block, Flopstyle: DARK makes use of a modified version of the "Bootstrap Image Box" by [[*user Timothy Foster]], which is hosted on the Wikidot Snippets site. You can view its documentation [*https://snippets.wikidot.com/code:bootstrap-image-box here].

Here is a brief overview:
[[/div]]

**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|float####var(--c-keyword)|=##**

----
= ,,//Alternative Text (Alt-Text)//,,
For accessibility reasons, I strongly recommend the use of **alt-text** in your images. If you need a detailed understanding of alt-text and its relation to accessibility, I recommend [*https://bighack.org/how-to-write-better-alt-text-descriptions-for-accessibility/ this article written by The Big Hack].

The gist is: When you set up an image, chances are that some readers -- like those with visual impairment or blindness -- won't be able to view it. What alt-text does is provide a concise descriptor of said image that a screen reader can easily parse. Alt-text will also appear if the image file/link becomes unavailable.

To set up alt-text for an image, all you need to include is the {{alt}} field inside a **Bootstrap Image Box** or **[*https://www.wikidot.com/doc-wiki-syntax:images Wiki Syntax-inserted image]**.[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]][[span class="bt bb"]]NOTICE[[/span]] The Standard Image Block does not support alt-text[[/span]]

A demonstration:

[[div class="templateInfo templateSetup"]]
  [[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]
**##var(--c-keyword)|[[include##** ##var(--c-symbol)|:snippets:bs-image##
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|image####var(--c-keyword)|=##**Larry_the_cat.jpg
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|heading####var(--c-keyword)|=##**Larry the Cat
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|caption####var(--c-keyword)|=##**He is very soft.
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|link####var(--c-keyword)|=##**@@/local--files/theme:flopstyle-dark/Larry_the_cat.jpg@@
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|alt####var(--c-keyword)|=##Larry, a beige cat, sits alert in the yard.**
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|width####var(--c-keyword)|=##**300px
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|float####var(--c-keyword)|=##**middle
**##var(--c-keyword)||####var(--c-builtin)|kind####var(--c-keyword)|=##**primary
**##var(--c-keyword)|]]##**
  [[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[include :snippets:bs-image
|image=Larry_the_cat.jpg
|heading=Larry the Cat
|caption=He is very soft.
|link=/local--files/theme:flopstyle-dark/Larry_the_cat.jpg
|alt=Larry, a beige cat, sits alert in the yard.
|width=300px
|float=middle
|kind=primary
]]

= Pay attention to the {{alt}} field. That's what a screen reader will convey to its user.

A {{scene-break}} is an ornamental symbol that “signals a pause for the reader and a transition in the narrative.”

Scene breaks are a classic print convention. Here is an example of one from //[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Section_(typography)#/media/File:Section_break_01_by_Pengo.jpg Alice's Adventures in Wonderland]//. On the SCP Wiki, a {{scene-break}} would be most appropriate in Tale writing.

{{icon-tint}} should only be used in tandem with black logos. Control the icon's color by modifying the {{@@--@@hue}} variable inside {{[[module CSS]]}}:

[[div class="code terminal terminal--dark"]]

/**

 *

 @import url(https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Comic+Neue&display=swap);
